answers.answer: Yup me too so you're not alone!!!! I hate the waiting part. AF is due on Friday. I swear it'll be the longest week ever!!!So this will be your 3rd? This will be my first child if the pregnancy takes.  I just recently had a MC so this was our first time TTC since that. I'm anxious, excited, scared, all of it at the same time. Aarrgghh!!!Just a question - I'm still trying to figure out what a lot of the acronymns mean....what's dpo? Day's past/post ovulation?Happe Baby dust to you :)

I'm so glad it's not just me!  Actually I tested yesterday but it was a bfn (big fat negative).  I knew it would be but I couldn't help myself!!  I'm testing again on Thurs...IF I can hold out that long.  I swear if I had a $1 for every negative test I've had..LOLYes this would be my 3rd.  I got pregnant last year while on the pill (shock!) but sadly MC at about 7 weeks.  Got pregnant again right away (twins) and lost them at 8 weeks.  I started temping right after the last one and realized that my luteal phase was short so am on progesterone beginning on cd14.  Hopefully that'll fix the problem.Yep, dpo (days past ovulation)  It took me 4EVER to figure all of them out.Baby dust to you too!!!

Keep me posted on your results!I think I'm going to pick up one of those early HPT tonight and try it out tomorrow morning - you know, give myself the best possible chance of getting a positive!!It's funny...even buying the tests makes me really nervous. I've actually gone to the store in the past and left again without it, becaue I just couldn't bring myself to go to the cash register!!! I know, I'm a moron ;)Why does a short luteal phase make a difference? I remember reading about the luteal phase but I can't remember many details.....

It's crazy how long it seems when you waiting to test.  I remember waiting and I test 7days before af was due and got my BFP.  I took a test every other day for about 10days because I couldn't belive it.  I just had my baby boy in June.  If it doesn't happen this time have faith you will get there good luck

Hillarious!  It's not like you were buying condoms!!  HA HA!  I buy the Answer early results test.  They're made by the same people who make the First Response but they're way cheaper.A short luteal phase can mean that my body isn't producing enough progesterone, which is what is needed to support a pregnancy before the placenta kicks in.  You can tell from temping how long your luteal phase is.  I've learned so much since my last MC, just searching the web and temping.  My dr was impressed at how much I knew about my body.
Wow!  You did get an early BFP!  Lucky!!!

Good luck to everyone, I know how difficult it is to wait! I had to buy many pregnancy tests over the past year. I get weird looks and comments everytime I go pay for them!  I am 24yrs. old, but I look like I am not a day over 14, lol.  And my husband is significantly older than I am, so when I start showing (I am almost 12wks) we will be getting A LOT more looks when we walk hand in hand!

I think that's part of why I hate buying them. I am actually 29, but people tell me I look 19, sometimes even younger. Maybe I think people are going to give me funny looks...but really it's none of their business, right!Anyway, I picked up a First Reponse last night, but it was negative when I tested :( (last night - I couldn't wait until this morning - acutally my husband couldn't wait!!)I'm really hoping that it's just too early - although AF is due on Friday.  It says on the package that there is like a 63% success rate that far in advance, which really isn't much more than 50/50.Anyway, I'm just prayng and praying and praying that AF doesn't come in a few days.

Well I broke down and took another test today...still negative.  ****!  I know it's too early but if I have a test in the house, I'm not happy until I've taken it.  So this was the last test in the cabinet and I flatly refuse to go buy any more until Thurs...lol.  I'm obsessed!

Ha ha! I have another in the cabinet....I'm just going to try and hold out for another day or so. (by then AF will almost be due anyway!!)Something I HAVE noticed though. I have a headcold, sore throat and a slight fever. The EXACT same thing happend the first time I got pregnant, about the same time (before I knew I was).Coincidence? Have you ever heard anything like that before?

Very interesting!  I'm not sure if it has anything to do w/ it but it would get me excited if it were symptoms like the last time.Since we're comparing symptoms, the past 3 months I've had spotting for about 7 days prior to AF and this month I'm not spotting!!!  Gosh I hope this is our month!  Why is it that if you're on vacation for a week, the time flies but the TWW will never end!??  This is torture!!!

I am also waiting to test.  I had 6 embryos transferred on October 14.  The doctor says they were all very good quality (2s and 3s).  The other 8 are still in the lab and those that survive will be cryopreserved.  We are praying for good, solid attachment to my uterine wall.  I go for a blood test on Oct. 26th.  Please keep us in your prayers.  This is our 3rd attempt.On another note, I am still experiencing pain/discomfort from the retrieval.  There were many follicles and 21 eggs were retrieved.  I was told that the more follicles, the more chance of pain.  However, that was on Thursday, Oct 11th.  My stomach feels like it is filled with a a bunch of air and my bladder is very tender.  I also get nauseated after eating.  Has anyone experienced this?One more thing - I have to go out of town on Tuesday and will fly.  Are there any concerns with flying before testing?

I am also waiting to test. On sept 14 i had an implanon took out of my arm...after i spotted for 3 days a dark brown discharge maybe it was supposed to be my period. my husband and i have only been ttc for 1 month. i made my husband go buy me a test, he got the ept, i took it at 10:00 one night but it was negative. I think i still am that was 5 days ago. My period was due on Oct 12. I  have pain and discomfort in my lower abdomen and always feel like im gonna start my pd but i dont....any help? To abrahan$sarah i will pray for you wish the best of luck...i too get nausea after i eat and my bladder is so sensative i wake up all night having to urinate.

Wow, good luck abraham&sarah. Unfortunately I have never been though a retrieval so I can't comment on that part. However, I don't you don't need to be concerned about flying. It shouldn't affect your testing :)CLeigh, you could very well be pregnant - nausea, frequent urination, and sometimes slight cramping CAN all be symptoms. It might have just been too early for the test you took to read anything. Since you're currently 4 days late, have you tried another test? If you don't start your period in a few days and your HPT are still coming out negative, the best thing is to go to the doctor - they'll send you for blood tests. If it isn't the result you had hoped, don't worry. It's only your first try and if often takes a few attempts :)momof3 - I hope this is our month too!!!Good luck everyone!!!
Isn't is just amazing how advanced technology and medicine are??  I wish you the very best of luck and keep us posted!
Hey momof3, did you test again this morning, or are you holding out?Good luck!

So I took another HPT this morning....only one day before AF due....still negative.This sucks...I'm pretty disappointed. I'm still holding out that it's just too early, but I think that might be optimistic. This might just not be my month :(

I broke down this morning and tested again (I swear I need an intervention!) and it's still negative, but I'm only 10dpo so I'm still crossing my fingers (and my eyes, legs and toes) that it's too early.  The last time I was pregnant I got a bfp at 10dpo but I was carrying twins.  I'm still not spotting and my temp is up.  I think I'm going to be heartbroken if I see AF this month b/c I've gotten myself so excited.  Usually I'm like, eh..oh well...I just really have that nagging, back of the brain, feeling that I am pregnant.You keep holding out until you see AF and I'll be praying for your BFP!

Just thought I may brighten this talk for you, I test a day before with a hpt and was negative, I also had my blood drawn 2 days before my period was due and that was negative. I day late and I got a postive hpt. So keep holding hope!

Well I hope that's the case for me. I will definitely hold out hope until AF arrives (or doesn't if I'm lucky!) I just know I"ll be so disappointed if it doesn't happen this month. I'm having these strange cramps today - at first I thought they were a sign AF was coming, but now I'm not so sure, cause they're a little different, and more towards my left side. Oh I"m so anxious I'm reading into everything!!!
amberd5191-what a wonderful surprise!  Makes me more hopeful than ever.Lil Pig-I'm analyzing all my twinges and cramps too!  This waiting STINKS!  LOL
Overanalyzing for sure!!!I'm sitting here, supposed to be working BTW, and all I can think about it the twinge in my side!!!!I'm going INSANE, LOL!!! :)

I am scheduled for a blood test on Oct 26.  This is a long wait.  I'm trying to view it as a wait for my pregnancy to be confirmed.  I just believe that I am pregnant.  I have cramping, including towards my right side, sorta under my rib.  And, I also have flutters and pelvic discomfort.  I feel fatigue and tired.  I am really gassy and bloated too - TMI.  I read that all these symptoms could be from the Prometrium.  All except the flutters.  The flutters was explained as one of the signs of pregnancy as the burrowing process takes place.  Anyone else have flutters?

I don't think I've had flutters. I haven't had much of anything to be honest, until the cramping today.But I haven't had my usual PMS symptoms either, which I find strange.I think I'm just reading too much into EVERYTHING!

I'm supposed to be working too but who can work when they think they're pregnant!??  Glad my boss is leaving early..hehe...so I can stalk this site and every other pregnancy site out there.I haven't heard of having flutters but heck, anything is possible.  I'm on Prometrium too and the only side effect I have is very tender bb's every month, but I've read there are some side effects just like the ones you're having.
My days at work seem to be going by so slowly when it is usually the opposite.   Arrrrggghhhh!

I bet they are since you have to wait until the 26th!  Good grief!  I'd be bald by then!!!  I'm going batty just trying to wait until Sat.  I wish they made an "instant" test that would work right after bd-ing!  lol

Well, it looks like this isn't my month :(AF has arrived, like clockwork!. I am SOOO disappointed. I just don't understand. We did everything right, or so I thought. It worked the first time, why not now? And I thought you were supposed be more fertile after a MC? I am so PO'ed right now.It's funny, cause I'm still saying to myself, maybe it's just spotting, and it's not really AF (cause it is just light spotting as of right now) - but that would just be too good to be true.Oh well.....looks we'll be trying again in a little while. My husband is going away on a business trip, but he arranged his schedule to make sure he was home in time for the fertile days. He did it just in case we didn't get pregnant this month. Good thing he had the sense to do that!I hope the rest of you have better luck :)

Aww, I'm sooo sorry this wasn't your month.  It's heartwrenching, frusterating, disappointing, aggravating, sadening (shall I go on??) all at the same time.  I wish I had answers as to why it works for some and not for others.  However, I'm still in the game as no sign of AF yet but have had some crampiness but not normal AF cramps, so I'm testing tomorrow.  Can you believe I got up this morning and did not test and there was a test in the cabinet!??!  I'm amazed!  LOL  I'll keep you posted and you keep your head up and I'll be praying that next month is YOUR month!
Thanks!I hope this month works out for you better than it did for me :)Keep us posted on what happens over the next few days!

I'm sooooooooooooooooo sorry your results weren't different.  It is difficult to understand why and the pain is so great. I'm praying for your comfort and healing.  I'm believing with you that you will conceive, bare and deliver a healthy wholesome baby the next time.  It sounds like you have a great support in your husband, so I'm sure that helps some.

Thanks for your kind words!It is a little frustrating, but I believe it will happen soon. I bought an OPK this weekend to help us out a little and increase our chances this next cycle, so I"m crossing my fingers.How are you holding in with your waiting?? Only a few more days to go. Good luck!!

I am doing well.  The waiting is very undesirable but I'm not anxious.  I am reading the bible as much as possible to make sure I'm constantly thinking and speaking God's truth instead of fearing what I'm experiencing.  I'm also reading a book called Prayers & Promises for Supernatural Childbirth by Jackie Mize.  It is helping me to stay positive and to keep my thinking on track.  Thank you for your well wishes and I believe the best is yet to come for you.

Well, I'm out and it sucks!  AF reared her ugly head this morning.  I think if I have a good cry I'll feel better but it's hard to do while at work.  I'm having blood work done on Wed morning testing my FSH levels to see what quality/quantity eggs I'm producing since I'm 36.  Hopefully everything is normal on my end and I'll just have to keep practicing.

This was supposed to be for you!I am doing well.  The waiting is very undesirable but I'm not anxious.  I am reading the bible as much as possible to make sure I'm constantly thinking and speaking God's truth instead of fearing what I'm experiencing.  I'm also reading a book called Prayers & Promises for Supernatural Childbirth by Jackie Mize.  It is helping me to stay positive and to keep my thinking on track.  Thank you for your well wishes and I believe the best is yet to come for you.
Sorry to hear the bad news.  Keep us posted on the FSH levels.

I feel your pain!!! It sucks, but on the bright side, you can have fun TTC again. (That's the way my husband looks at it :) ) I've never had my FSH levels tested....should I? I'm 29.Hopefully abraham&sarah will break this trend and have better news in a few days. I'm crossing fingers for you!!!!

Well not as much fun as it used to be unfortunately.  I seem to be the only one w/ a working libido!  (LOL but not really)  I wouldn't be too concerned about your FSH levels yet.  My dr is checking me b/c of my age and the fact that you could look at me wrong before and I'd get pregnant...now it's been like 7 months and nothing.  We want to make sure I'm not peri-menopausal since I've had tons of spotting for the past couple of months.  I think we got that straight though b/c my dr put me on a powerful antibiotic to treat me for PID (not sure if I actually had PID but it was just to cover the bases).  After the antibiotic I had no spotting so maybe I did have PID.  Anyhoo, I'll let you know what the tests say.  Hopefully all my little eggs are normal and there are lots of them.I know you'll find some inner peace with all of your reading.  I try to remember that God has a plan for me, with or without, another baby.  Please let us know what the blood tests show!  I know you're so excited!

I am really grateful for you guys.  You are certainly a blessing to me in this process.  I just feel better talking about it and knowing someone else can actually feel what I feel.  While my husband is the greatest, talking with other women somehow gives peace of mind because we can relate on a different level.  It means a lot to have others cheering me on too.  I haven't shared with my family and friends that I'm even going through this process, let alone for the 3rd time, because I don't want comments or even questions, if you know what I mean.  I don't know if that's perceived as selfish or not but it is very sensitive for me.  Thank you so much for being there.

I kept poking in to this post to see some BFP posts... and I am bummed out for you guys!  Last year at this time I was TTC...  I started TTC in August and in Jan I got pregnant.... wow, what a long 5 months!  then in feb I lost that baby...  it was crushed...  finally in May I got pg again and I am 26 weeks...  I guess I feel so much for you guys because just a year ago I was in your shoes... so I hope my post brings some hope to you that it will happen, and even though it didn't happen exactly as I wanted it, it is happening, and I know it will for you all too...  you are in my prayers and thoughts!  Good luck!  I really do wish you all the best of luck and I am so sorry to hear about your AF's... :(  I was really bummed out for you guys!  Hang in there and try to remember to have fun...  I just wanted you guys to know that I was thinking about you all!  baby dust!

I am also waiting to test. Sorry about all the neg tests, it is so heartwrenching only seeing one line come up. I swear my heart breaks every time i see it... yet I continue to put myself through it. I am going to have to start budgeting for tests. AF is a day late, test neg. Suppose too early. When I hear some people get positives days and days before period is due, it is quite disheartening but I am sure we will all have our BFPs soon!!

M2B, there are also lots of stories out there with false negatives.....so hope for that :)Baby dust to you also!Tatorbug, wow that is quite the story. Sounds like things are going great for you now. Your story is definitely encouraging - after all that struggle you finally have a  baby on the way!Good luck and enjoy the ride :)Will keep everyone posted on any BFP's in the future. I'm getting ready for another roller coaster ride of waiting and hoping over the next few weeks! Like abraham&sarah said, it's great to have people that you can talk to to who understand!

Ok now I'm totally obsessing!!! I've bought a slew of OPK and HPT for this upcoming attempt,  and it's all I can think about. I'm looking up everything I can on TTC, even though it's all the same and I've read it over and over again. I can't even concentrate on my work - it's getting a bit ridiculous. And it's only CD5 - only 23 more to go!! *groan*
You're so funny!  Sounds like "we" need an intervention!  LOL  I think if I read that standing on your head after bd-ing worked, I would!  Do you have any kids now?

I obsessed about it too and both months this year that I got pregnant was when I couldn;t take it any more and decided to give it a break...  just a thought!  sometimes all the stress of it can make your cycle screwy...  IF and only IF it doesn't work this month, but I think it will!!  but IF is doesn't, next month try to NOT TTC... I know it sounds weird...  in Jan when I got pregnant it was new years eve,  the last think on my mind was TTC...  I just wanted to have some fun that night!  :)  Then again in May, our city hosted the AIA (american institute of architects) convention and I had been so busy with events that my DH and I didn't see each other much that week...  I actually didn't even think I was ovulating because it should have been about a week later (because my cycles were long the first few months after the m/c)...   we just did the deed to have some fun since we hadn't seen much of each other that week...  and low and behold I am now 26 weeks along!! :)It is not easy to not think about it ALL the time, trust me...  I know...  but try to just relax and have fun with it too...  the months I stress the most I didn't have much luck!!How long have you been TTC?

Nope I don't have any kids yet. This will be my first, whenever it happens.My hubby and I went on long awaited trip to Australia and New Zealand last April, and we had decided to TTC after that. It was kind of like our last big hurrah. We got pregnant the first time we actually tried to time it and everything, but that unfortunately ended in a MC at 12 weeks, which was mid-late August.I was told to wait at least one cycle before TTC again, which we did, but it was agonizing, plus the cycle was about a week longer. So as soon as AF arrived, we tried that month, but it didn't work. So here I am again, on my second cycle since the MC. So really we've only tried once since the MC so it hasn't been that long at all.The worst part about it was that I have 3 friends and we were all due within a few days or weeks of one another. Now they're all getting big and round and I feel left out. (luckily 2 of the 3 live in different provinces so it makes it a LITTLE easier).Anyway, I haven't given up hope yet, although some days I feel like it and wonder is it really worth this roller coaster ride. The other days I get really excited and think, ok this is going to be the month!!Maybe giving it a break will work for me too....but I'll wait until the cycle after this one to try that! ha ha!!!

I'm sure you'll get your bfp soon!  I got pregnant the 2nd cycle after my first MC, so be patient (yeah, right!) and it'll happen.  The hardest part for me was seeing people who found out they were pregnant about the same time I did and they ended up delivering healthy babies as where I had none.  I have faith that our time is coming!  So for now, let's keep the OPK and HPT companies in busines!!

you are too funny!  I was pregnant the 3rd cycle after the m/c...  I had a d&c on Feb 14th and concieved on May 7th...  so hopefully you will get pregnant soon...  I was frustrated because the first 2 cycles after my period were longer then normal, so I kept missing it!  This will be your month!!  :)

You know what's really funny? My husband is on a business trip right now, and I told him he had to arrange his flight schedule so that he wouldn't miss my fertile days next week. He did too, God love him :)

6:30 a.m.  Then, I'll be in a training session all day at work.  Do you really think I'll be able to concentrate?  Not a chance :-0

Since joining this forum, I feel that I really have friends who understand and are genuinely pushing for my success.  Now, I not only want success for my husband and I, but I want success so others will also be encouraged and hopeful.  Thanks to you and all.
Good luck tomorrow! We'll be anxiously awaiting your results :)

I'm waiting, already 13dpo.  Looks bad.

I KNOW!!! I've been checking this post since about 8am (NDST - 6:30 EDST) on Friday!abraham&sarah, we're anxiously waiting for some word......I have a good feeling about it all, so hopefully my instincts are right :)momof32b, I think my husband totally understands what your's must be feeling ;) Congrats on the FSH levels, BTW!!
Why does it look bad?? 13 dpo, must be getting close to AF time by now....Good luck!

14dpo, BFN.  BD before and on the day of ovulation.  My 4th month already.  What went wrong with my system since I gave birth?  My first time TTC was so easy.  First shot hit the jackpot.  Waiting for AF.

I'm going to send out a personal message just to her to see if she'll respond.  I'm worried now b/c it's Mon and still no word from her.Sorry you're getting a BFN.  My first 2 kids were a wham, bam, thank you ma'am as well.  I've been trying since March and still nothing.  I obsess about it too!  Maybe we should relax...but it's hard to do!  Good luck!
Hello there.  Sorry for the delay in informing of the results.  I'm not usually on email over the weekend.  It's a BFN.  Got AF this morning.  I'm devastated!  Been crying all weekend long.
Oh, dear!  I'm sooooo sorry!  My heart goes out to you!!
Much thanks momof32b.

I read that someone said you are supposed to be more fertile after MC.. is that only if you have had a D&C?My fiance and I got pregnant the first time we tried- one week after telling our families, I miscaried.It's six weeks later and no period. I have read that since I did not have a D&C and miscarried naturally so early in the pregnancy that while recommended, it wasn't necessary to wait until after the first period post MC.  We have had sex 3-4 times since the miscarriage and I thought I would get my period by now. My breasts are alittle tender and I feel bloated.. all PMS symptoms but also all symptoms I had 7-8 weeks ago when I was pregnant. I took 3 tests- all negative. I feel like I am losing my mind.  My fiance and I both have 1 eleven year old daughter each from previous marriages and 7 years ago I gave a baby up for adoption because I could not take care of two children on my own and I did not want to have an aboortion .... Now I feel like I am incompetent and unworthy- like I can't or don't deserve to have another kid.... I know I have no right to say this after only one miscarriage and some of you have had several and maybe never had one successful pregnancy... if I offend you I'm sorry I'm just an emotional wreck and I feel like I am apologizing to everyone... my fiance - his family.....I just wish I knew.. the waiting game...   the anticipation... the absolute fear.  Even if we are successful every week will be scary ... I used to think all  I have to do is get to the 12th week and I see so many people lose the pregnancy even then--- So for right now I am taking prenatals, no caffiene, trying to maintain a good diet and I wish I could fast forward to the day that I either get my period or a BFP so that I can figure out where to go from there.....So back to where I started.... is it true that you can be more fertile after a MC?BTW  some of you amaze me with how strong and positive you are.....if you can't spread the baby dust maybe you can help me there too.

I am soooooo sorry about your results! I am crushed - truly disappointed for you. My heart sank when I read your post. I don't know how else to describe it. I swear I feel about as disappointed as if it had happened to me! I guess that's becuase we're been following each other's progress so closely. Well.....I guess we're all back to square one again, and next month will be more of the same.Either way, we'll all get through this :) Maybe it's because I haven't been crushed enough yet (God help me!), but I am still full of hope for all of us!!!(BTW,  I think POAS has become my new obsession - first HPT a few weeks ago, now OPK, then it'll be back to HPT. Good Lord!!)

Aww, thank you for your heartfelt expressions.  I can't believe it.  I was so sure it was going to work this time.  I can relate when you say maybe you haven't been crushed enough yet.  I feel like I can't do it again. However, I am talking with my doctor about transferring my 3 cryopreserved embryos.  My cycle started today, so I would go for an ultrasound and blood work on November 9th. If everything looks good with the lining, they can do the transfer around the 10th or so.  This is all predicated upon me coming up with $4,000 for the procedure.  I have exhausted health insurance since none of the 3 IVF attempts were successful.  So we will see what happens.My husband has already been talking about donor eggs.  I guess I would consider that last resort.  I have some insecurities with it though.Anyway, that's funny about the POAS.  Thanks for the laugh.  I needed that.

It's amazing what we'll do to have a baby, huh? I haven't yet had to go through what you have, and I hope I never do, but I certainly would do what I could if I had to. I think I can understand the donor egg issues as well.  It's not a decision to be taken lightly, but I think you can only do what is right for you :) You'll get there!!

I went through the same thing, natural mc early in preg., like i was only a couple weeks didnt even know i was preg. until i was in pain and bleeding, and im wondering the same thing. so your not alone.

I have also heard that you're more fertile after a mc...not sure how true it is, as it doesn't appear to be the case for me. In fact I'm starting to wondering if I'm even ovulating anymore!!Last month was the frist time we TTC after the MC, and we did everything right (which worked the first time) but it wasn't our month. Now we're on our second attempt. I'm trying to track CM, using OPK, and so far nothing. In fact everything seems to be saying that so far I'm showing no signs of fertility this month. I'm hoping that maybe it's just early (on day 13 of cycle), but shouldn't I be seeing something by now?? In the past I've always been an early ovulator (like day 10-12), but since the mc I feel like things have changed. And I don't know if I'm being paranoid or not, but I just have a feeling that something is not right, know what I mean?? Maybe I'm just freaking out.

I was just thinking about you this morning and wondering if you were gearing up for your hubby's return.  I'm am trying to plan my weekend around my husbands pool tournament...which means I'll probably have to be up and waiting on him when he gets home in the weee hours of the night.  Oh well!  I guess I'll just have to nap!!  LOL  Anyhoo, since we're on the topic of fertility and miscarriage, I had my first miscarriage in Oct 06, had one period and got pregnant again right after that!  It too, sadly ended in miscarriage.  I've been trying ever since that MC and nothing, so I don't know if there's any truth in the "more fertile after MC" myth or not since I've been on both ends of the spectrum.  Now, you mentioned that you don't know if you've O'd yet or not....have you ever thought about temping???  It's an awesome tool!  I always thought I O'd on cd13 or 14 but it turns out it's usually the cd15 or 16.  It will also help you learn about your luteal phase as well as IF you are O-ing or not.  It's an inexpensive way to learn alot about your body.  Fertilityfriend.com is very informative.  Good luck this month!

They had no idea what caused me to MC, and that early stage it's hard to find out. In most cases they don't know for sure, but they say it is most likely caused by chromosomal obnormalities. I MC at 12 weeks, although the US revealed that the baby had actually stopped growning at 6 weeks, so it was a missed MC. I was given 3 choices - a D&C, to wait to see if it happened naturally, or a prescription, called misoprostol. I took the misoprostol because it's less invasive but faster than if I has just waited. It took me 5 weeks after that for AF to come, so yes, you're cycle is probably off because of that as well. It's hard I know, but be patient!!! That's what I keep telling myself.BBT stands for Basal Body Temperature. It's a way to track when you've ovulated. Basically you have to take your temperature (get a thermometer especially for that) every morning at the same time. It has to be your resting temperature, so before you get out of bed or anything. You'll get a peak in your temperature AFTER you've ovulated. It'll help you understand your cycle. BUT you might want to use OPK as well, since they'll give you an indication BEFORE you ovulate, so you can time the BD better :) Then the BBT will let you know when you've finished ovulation, and you can just wait.momof32b told me about a great site which has lots of good information on how to do all this, and you can input your info and it helps you track and tells you when your best chances are to conceive etc. It's called fertilityfriend.comGood luck!!

How cool momof32b!  As sorry I feel for you, I can't wait to be in your position.  LOL  It's the greatest sickness in the world!I took my test this morning and BFN :(  I have cried all morning.  I would of handled a BFN a lot better if I didn't see that BFP.  I'm temped to call the company that made the test and let them hear how much this has devastated me.The test I used this morning is known to be the most reliable so I am going with those results.  Thank God I only told a few people other than you ladies.  It is heart breaking to have to go back and tell them differently.  I have taken many hpts in the past and this is the first time I have ever had a "false positive".  I have learned a lesson though.  Wait until the second test results before opening mouth...LOLI know that God has a day and time for my baby.  So I'll pick up the pieces and move on :)Thank you so much ladies for all of your support and for going with me on this roller coaster ride...

You've got a very valid point.  How many dpo are you again?

I believe I am 13 to 14 dpo.  If AF comes then I am going to start taking my temps and charting those along with my CM and CP better.   My cycles are around 40 days since I quit taking birth control.  That's the hard part for me, I have soooo long that I have to wait before I have a fertility window.  Not to mention we start bd'ing early just in case my cycles decide to start to become more regular so we are at it for almost 3 weeks. (from CD 8 all the way through the time that I show I should ovulate till around CD 28) We usually bd every other day or the latest 2 days apart in that 3 week period.  I think I ovulate around CD 26 but we go to 28 to be sure.Since I haven't pin pointed when I ovulate exactly my fertility calendar shows everything as CD.

Boy you do have long cycles.  Mine were 25-26.  I think you'll get a lot of benefit from charting your temps.  It will allow you to see patterns in your cycles as well as let you know exactly when to start using OPK's 'cause them bad boys are EXPENSIVE!

I guess my temping questions is realy just this - how reliable are they if you're a poor sleeper?For instance on Monday night I slept pretty restlessly and the woke fully at about 5:30am - I took my temp just in case. It was 97.13. My alarm goes off at 6:15 (that's when I had planned to do all my temping). I slept well from 5:30 until my alarm went off. I took temp again and it was 97.47. Now, which should I use?Similary the following night I woke up at 5:45am, and hadn't slept TOO badly up to that point. My temp was 97.27. Checked again at 6:45 before I got out of bed and it was 97.54.Now this morning I slept pretty well right until my alarm went off at 6:15, and my temp was 97.61 (I did feel really warm this morning.)See, my temps are all over the place. I know it says you should get a good 3 hours of sleep before temping, but good sleep for me is hard to come by. So should I take my temp when I wake up after sleeping restlessly, or take it after the one good hour (almost) I usually get between 5:30 adn 6:15???Too much info I know, but just wondering what your opinion is. THX!

Hi everyone,i hope you dont mind if i join you here?First of all i want to say CONGRATS to all of you who got BFP.I have been talking to unbornandworried for a while now and we are both going through the same thing. I had a miscarriage on the 20th of Oct,jus a few hrs after i found out i was pregnant.I had a natural m/c and it lasted only a week.my levels did go back down to '0', but now am feeling pregnancy symptoms again.For the past 2weeks or so ave been having mild abdominal cramps,high temperature,nausea,tingly breasts.Last wednesday wen i go toilet i saw light pink blood on the tissue which only lasted about 2hrs,then saturday i could swear af was coming because i had period like cramps but i only spotted brown for about 2hrs again,the same thing also happen to me monday and yesterday but yesterday i had alot of brown spotting.At one point on tuesday my breasts were hurting that much i had to remove my bra.I feel fine one day and the other day i get symptoms.Today is the 25days since i finished miscarrying.Can anyone give me their opinion please?I already done a test but it was a BFN,it might have been too early even if i was preg.Am thinking of going to the doc next week if af doesnt arrive by then but in the mean time i would love to get ur opinions.Thank you and goodluck to all of us who are waiting to test,hope we all get a BFP.God bless us all.

I wish you best of luck this month!!!!

Hey!  I've been off for the long Thanksgiving weekend, so sorry for not posting.  I wouldn't be too worried about your waking time.  If it were me, I'd use my first temp...unless I was able to fall back asleep right away, then take it when your alarm goes off.  I know that if I wake up later my temp will be a small amount higher but not enough to effect the overall picture.  You're looking for patterns at this point.  Do you see a dip prior to O?  Does your cm correspond w/ the days prior to O?  For now, just temp and let's look at your chart after one cycle.  It took me about 3 months to get the hang of it.I'm feeling kinda yucky today.  I'm officially 5 weeks (seems so much longer since I found out so early) and from what I remember about my other pregnancies, 5 weeks usually marks the beginning of my "blah" period.  I just hope it's not too bad this time.

question: Anybody out there waiting to test?  I'm 7dpo and just praying for a positive!  I need some company, so I won't feel like it's just me.
